qas.question: In what year was the never ending story made?
What award did Nowhere in Africa win in 2002?

answers.text: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film

qas.question: In what year did The Lives of Others win the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language?
How often is the Berlin International Film Festival held?
What was the first year of the Berlin International Film Festival?
What did Carolina Link get an Acadamy award for in the 20th century?
What film festival was held yearly until 1951?

context: More recently, films such as Das Boot (1981), The Never Ending Story (<a0_0>1984<a0_0/>) Run Lola Run (1998), Das Experiment (2001), Good Bye Lenin! (2003), Gegen die Wand (Head-on) (2004) and Der Untergang (Downfall) (2004) have enjoyed international success. In 2002 the <a1_0>Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film<a1_0/> went to Caroline Link's <b5_0>Nowhere in Africa,<b5_0/> in <a2_0>2007<a2_0/> to Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck's The Lives of Others. <b6_0>The Berlin International Film Festival,<b6_0/> held <a3_0>yearly<a3_0/> since <a4_0>1951<a4_0/>, is one of the world's foremost film and cinema festivals.
